title: Course description
text:
Course title: Seminar 2: writing and publishing academic papers  Class schedule: July – November | Thursday 14:00 – 16:00 TH time  Instructor: Christopher Llones  e-mail: christopher.allones@gmail.com

Course description






This seminar provides graduate students with a comprehensive understanding of the academic writing and publishing process. Students will develop skills in writing research articles, conference papers, and other scholarly work. The course will cover the fundamentals of academic writing, strategies for navigating the peer-review process, and ethical considerations in scholarly publishing.





Course objectives







Understand the structure and style of different academic genres.
Develop research ideas into publishable manuscripts.
Effectively revise and edit their own work.
Navigate the peer-review process and respond to feedback.
Identify ethical considerations in academic publishing.

title: Course outline
text:
Week
Topics
Lessons
Activities




Week 1-2
Foundation of academic writing

Overview of academic writing genres and their purposes.
Discussion of the key principles of academic writing.
Introduction to the structure of academic papers.




Week 3-4
Developing research methods

Formulating research topics and research questions.
Identifying relevant literature and conducting a literature review.
Developing a thesis statement and creating an outline for a research paper.




Week 5-6
Writing first darf

Writing effective introductions and conclusions.
Crafting clear and concise methods and results section.
Writing persuasive literature and discussions.
Using appropriate language and tone in academic writing.




Week 7-8
Revising and editing

Strategies for revising and editing academic writing.
Peer review and feedback exercises.
Using tools and resources for editing and proofreading.




Week 9-10
Navigating peer-review process

Overview of the peer-review process in academic publishing.
Selecting appropriate journals for submission.
Preparing manuscripts for submission.
Responding to reviewer feedback and revising manuscripts.
